trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting dynamic membership for groups| Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting dynamic membership for groups| Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: A topic that lists troubleshooting tips for dynamic membership for groups in Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: A topic that lists troubleshooting tips for dynamic membership for groups in Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting dynamic memberships to groups
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting dynamic memberships to groups

trans-unit.source: Symptom
trans-unit.target: Symptom

trans-unit.source: Action
trans-unit.target: Action

trans-unit.source: I configured a rule on a group but no memberships get updated in the group
trans-unit.target: I configured a rule on a group but no memberships get updated in the group

trans-unit.source: Verify that the **Enable delegated group management** setting is set to Yes in the Directory Configure tab.
trans-unit.target: Verify that the **Enable delegated group management** setting is set to Yes in the Directory Configure tab.

trans-unit.source: You will see this setting only if you are signed in as a user to whom an Azure Active Directory Premium license is assigned.
trans-unit.target: You will see this setting only if you are signed in as a user to whom an Azure Active Directory Premium license is assigned.

trans-unit.source: Verify the values for user attributes on the rule: are there users that satisfy the rule?
trans-unit.target: Verify the values for user attributes on the rule: are there users that satisfy the rule?

trans-unit.source: I configured a rule, but now the existing members of the rule are removed
trans-unit.target: I configured a rule, but now the existing members of the rule are removed

trans-unit.source: This is expected behavior.
trans-unit.target: This is expected behavior.

trans-unit.source: Existing members of the group are removed when a rule is enabled or changed.
trans-unit.target: Existing members of the group are removed when a rule is enabled or changed.

trans-unit.source: The users returned from evaluation of the rule are added as members to the group.
trans-unit.target: The users returned from evaluation of the rule are added as members to the group.

trans-unit.source: I don’t see membership changes instantly when I add or change a rule, why not?
trans-unit.target: I don’t see membership changes instantly when I add or change a rule, why not?

trans-unit.source: Dedicated membership evaluation is done periodically in an asynchronous background process.
trans-unit.target: Dedicated membership evaluation is done periodically in an asynchronous background process.

trans-unit.source: How long the process takes is determined by the number of users in your directory and the size of the group created as a result of the rule.
trans-unit.target: How long the process takes is determined by the number of users in your directory and the size of the group created as a result of the rule.

trans-unit.source: Typically, directories with small numbers of users will see the group membership changes in less than a few minutes.
trans-unit.target: Typically, directories with small numbers of users will see the group membership changes in less than a few minutes.

trans-unit.source: Directories with a large number of users can take 30 minutes or longer to populate.
trans-unit.target: Directories with a large number of users can take 30 minutes or longer to populate.

trans-unit.target: These articles provide additional information on Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.target: Integrating your on-premises identities with Azure Active Directory
